channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: Urgent Patch: CISA Adds Actively Exploited Gogs RCE Flaw to KEV Catalog
item.description:
Headline: Urgent Patch: CISA Adds Actively Exploited Gogs RCE Flaw to KEV Catalog

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical path traversal vulnerability, CVE-2025-8110, in the Gogs self-hosted Git service to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. This flaw, which allows for remote code execution (RCE) via symlink manipulation, is confirmed to be actively exploited in the wild. With a CVSS score of 8.7, it bypasses a previous patch for CVE-2024-55947. Federal agencies are mandated to remediate by February 2, 2026. The vulnerability affects an estimated 1,600 internet-exposed Gogs servers, posing a significant risk to organizations using the platform for source code management.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: CISA has added CVE-2025-8110, a critical path traversal vulnerability in the Gogs self-hosted Git service, to its KEV catalog due to active exploitation. Learn about the RCE risk and mitigation steps.

Article Slug: cisa-adds-actively-exploited-gogs-rce-vulnerability-to-kev-catalog

Published Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Poetic Justice: BreachForums Hacked, Database of 324,000 Cybercriminals Leaked
item.description:
Headline: Poetic Justice: BreachForums Hacked, Database of 324,000 Cybercriminals Leaked

Summary:
In a significant turn of events for the cybercrime community, the user database for the notorious hacking marketplace BreachForums was leaked online on January 9, 2026. The dump contains sensitive records for 323,986 users, including usernames, email addresses, IP addresses, private messages, and Argon2-hashed passwords. The breach, allegedly occurring in August 2025 and claimed by an individual named "James," represents a major operational security failure and provides a trove of intelligence for law enforcement agencies seeking to identify and prosecute threat actors like 'IntelBroker' and 'ShinyHunters' who were active on the forum.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The user database of the notorious cybercrime marketplace BreachForums has been leaked, exposing the sensitive data of nearly 324,000 users, including threat actors like IntelBroker and ShinyHunters.

Article Slug: breachforums-user-database-leaked-exposing-324000-cybercriminals

Published Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Brightspeed Probes Breach Claim by 'Crimson Collective' Affecting Over 1M Customers
item.description:
Headline: Brightspeed Probes Breach Claim by 'Crimson Collective' Affecting Over 1M Customers

Summary:
U.S. broadband provider Brightspeed is actively investigating a significant cybersecurity event following a claim by the 'Crimson Collective' extortion group. The group alleges it breached Brightspeed's systems and stole the personally identifiable information (PII) of over one million residential customers, including names, addresses, and partial payment details. Crimson Collective, a group known for targeting AWS cloud environments, posted its claim on Telegram and threatened to leak the data if its demands are not met. Brightspeed, which serves 20 states, has acknowledged the threat and is working with authorities.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Brightspeed, a major US telecom provider, is investigating a data breach claim from the Crimson Collective extortion group, which alleges the theft of PII for over 1 million customers.

Article Slug: brightspeed-investigates-data-breach-claim-from-crimson-collective-affecting-1m-customers

Published Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: AI to Overtake Human Error as Top Cause of Breaches, Experian Predicts
item.description:
Headline: AI to Overtake Human Error as Top Cause of Breaches, Experian Predicts

Summary:
In its 13th Annual Data Breach Industry Forecast, Experian predicts a paradigm shift in cybersecurity for 2026, with autonomous AI agents potentially surpassing human error as the leading cause of data breaches. The report warns that threat actors are weaponizing AI to create sophisticated polymorphic malware, execute highly personalized attacks, and generate 'pristine synthetic identities' at scale from stolen data. This new wave of AI-driven threats, combined with the looming risk of quantum computing, is expected to fuel a massive spike in identity theft and fundamentally change the nature of cyberattacks.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: Report

Meta Description: Experian's 2026 Data Breach Forecast predicts that AI agents will surpass human error as the leading cause of data breaches, fueling a rise in synthetic identity fraud and polymorphic malware.

Article Slug: experian-forecasts-ai-agents-to-become-top-cause-of-data-breaches

Published Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: G7 Unveils Roadmap for Financial Sector's Transition to Post-Quantum Cryptography
item.description:
Headline: G7 Unveils Roadmap for Financial Sector's Transition to Post-Quantum Cryptography

Summary:
The G7 Cyber Expert Group (CEG), co-chaired by the U.S. Treasury and the Bank of England, has released a strategic roadmap to guide the global financial sector's transition to quantum-resilient technology. Published on January 12, 2026, the guidance addresses the existential threat that future quantum computers pose to current cryptographic standards like RSA and ECC. The non-prescriptive roadmap recommends a phased approach, urging firms to begin inventorying cryptographic assets by 2027 and aim for a full transition to Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC) by 2035 to mitigate 'harvest now, decrypt later' risks.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: The G7 Cyber Expert Group, led by the U.S. Treasury and Bank of England, has issued a roadmap for the financial sector's transition to Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC) to address risks from quantum computing.

Article Slug: g7-unveils-roadmap-for-post-quantum-cryptography-in-finance-sector

Published Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Oregon DEQ Kept Data Breach of 4,800 People Secret for Nine Months
item.description:
Headline: Oregon DEQ Kept Data Breach of 4,800 People Secret for Nine Months

Summary:
The Oregon Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) confirmed on January 13, 2026, that a cyberattack in April 2025 exposed the personal data of approximately 4,800 people. The agency opted not to issue a broad public disclosure, citing that Oregon law did not require it, and instead began sending notification letters to affected individuals in late December 2025, over eight months after the incident. The initial attack, which the Rhysida ransomware gang later claimed, caused significant operational disruption. The delay in notification has drawn criticism and raises questions about the agency's transparency and incident response process.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Incident Response, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The Oregon Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) has admitted to a data breach from April 2025 that affected 4,800 people, but only disclosed it nine months later, raising transparency concerns.

Article Slug: oregon-deq-data-breach-of-4800-people-kept-secret-for-nine-months

Published Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Logistics Cyberattacks to Double in 2026 as Hackers Target Supply Chain Networks
item.description:
Headline: Logistics Cyberattacks to Double in 2026 as Hackers Target Supply Chain Networks

Summary:
A new report from supply chain risk management firm Everstream Analytics predicts that cyberattacks targeting the logistics sector will double in 2026. The report highlights a staggering 965% increase in such incidents since 2021, with a 61% jump in 2025 alone. Threat actors, including state-sponsored groups from Russia, China, and Iran, are strategically shifting their focus from individual companies to shared transportation networks like ports and 3PLs to cause widespread, cascading disruption across the global supply chain. This trend has elevated logistics cyberattacks to a top-four supply chain risk for the coming year.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Threat Intelligence, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: Report

Meta Description: A new report from Everstream Analytics forecasts that cyberattacks on the logistics and supply chain sector will double in 2026, as threat actors target shared networks for maximum disruption.

Article Slug: logistics-cyberattacks-expected-to-double-in-2026-targeting-supply-chains

Published Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New Zealand's 'Manage My Health' Portal Breached; Data of 120,000 Patients Held for Ransom
item.description:
Headline: New Zealand's 'Manage My Health' Portal Breached; Data of 120,000 Patients Held for Ransom

Summary:
New Zealand's largest patient portal, Manage My Health, is responding to a significant data breach that occurred in late December 2025. An attacker using the alias 'Kazu' claims to have stolen over 400,000 files, including sensitive medical records like lab results and clinical notes, affecting up to 126,000 individuals. The attacker has demanded a $60,000 ransom. The breach originated from a vulnerability in the 'Health Documents' module of the application. Manage My Health has since closed the security gap and is working with New Zealand authorities, while the government has launched an urgent review of the incident.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: New Zealand's Manage My Health patient portal has suffered a major data breach, with an attacker named 'Kazu' stealing sensitive health data of up to 126,000 users and demanding a ransom.

Article Slug: new-zealand-patient-portal-manage-my-health-hit-by-ransomware

Published Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CVSS 10.0 'Ni8mare' Bug in n8n Allows Unauthenticated RCE
item.description:
Headline: CVSS 10.0 'Ni8mare' Bug in n8n Allows Unauthenticated RCE

Summary:
A critical unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, dubbed 'Ni8mare' and tracked as CVE-2026-21858, has been disclosed in the n8n workflow automation platform. The flaw, rated a maximum 10.0 on the CVSS scale, stems from a content-type confusion bug in the Form Webhook node. It allows an unauthenticated attacker to read arbitrary files, expose sensitive credentials, and ultimately achieve full RCE on vulnerable instances. The flaw affects n8n versions prior to 1.121.0, and with tens of thousands of instances exposed online, administrators are urged to patch immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: A critical CVSS 10.0 vulnerability, CVE-2026-21858 ('Ni8mare'), in the n8n workflow automation platform allows for unauthenticated RCE. Learn about the risks and how to patch immediately.

Article Slug: critical-unauthenticated-rce-flaw-ni8mare-in-n8n-automation-platform

Published Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: 'CrazyHunter' Ransomware Targets Taiwanese Hospitals with Advanced Tactics
item.description:
Headline: 'CrazyHunter' Ransomware Targets Taiwanese Hospitals with Advanced Tactics

Summary:
A sophisticated Go-based ransomware variant named CrazyHunter is escalating attacks, primarily targeting the healthcare sector in Taiwan with at least six confirmed victims. According to research from Trellix, CrazyHunter is a fork of the open-source 'Prince Ransomware' but incorporates significant enhancements. The attackers use weak Active Directory passwords for initial access, leverage the SharpGPOAbuse tool for rapid network-wide deployment, and employ Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver (BYOVD) techniques to disable security software. The ransomware uses a hybrid ChaCha20 and ECIES encryption scheme and appends the `.Hunter` extension to files.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The CrazyHunter ransomware, a sophisticated variant of Prince ransomware, is targeting Taiwanese healthcare organizations using advanced tactics like GPO abuse and BYOVD for defense evasion.

Article Slug: crazyhunter-ransomware-escalates-attacks-on-taiwanese-healthcare

Published Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: GoBruteforcer Botnet Targets Linux Servers with Weak Passwords and AI-Generated Defaults
item.description:
Headline: GoBruteforcer Botnet Targets Linux Servers with Weak Passwords and AI-Generated Defaults

Summary:
A modular, Go-based botnet named GoBruteforcer is actively targeting Linux servers by brute-forcing weak passwords for exposed services like phpMyAdmin, MySQL, and FTP. According to Check Point Research, the campaign's success is fueled by two trends: the continued use of insecure legacy web stacks and the proliferation of insecure default configurations suggested by AI tools. The botnet turns compromised machines into scanners to find more victims. The financially motivated attackers also deploy tools to scan for and drain cryptocurrency wallets on compromised servers, with a focus on TRON and Binance Smart Chain.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Cyberattack, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A Go-based botnet, GoBruteforcer, is actively targeting Linux servers by brute-forcing weak passwords on services like phpMyAdmin and MySQL, with a link to insecure, AI-generated default credentials.

Article Slug: gobuteforcer-botnet-exploits-weak-passwords-in-linux-servers-fueled-by-ai-defaults

Published Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: French Immigration Agency Data Leaked via Third-Party Breach
item.description:
Headline: French Immigration Agency Data Leaked via Third-Party Breach

Summary:
France's Office for Immigration and Integration (OFII) has confirmed a data breach originating from a compromised third-party service provider. In early January 2026, a hacker claimed to be selling a database of up to 2.1 million records of foreign residents on BreachForums, posting samples that included names, contact details, and nationalities. OFII clarified that its own systems were not breached, but that the attack targeted a private training provider responsible for mandatory integration courses. The incident highlights the significant risks of supply chain attacks for government agencies and could lead to GDPR penalties for OFII as the data controller.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: France's immigration agency, OFII, confirms a data breach via a third-party contractor, leading to the leak of foreign residents' personal data. A hacker claims to be selling 2.1 million records.

Article Slug: french-immigration-agency-data-leaked-via-third-party-contractor-breach

Published Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 13 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CrazyHunter Ransomware Cripples Taiwanese Hospitals with Advanced Tactics
item.description:
Headline: CrazyHunter Ransomware Cripples Taiwanese Hospitals with Advanced Tactics

Summary:
The CrazyHunter ransomware, a sophisticated fork of the open-source Prince ransomware, has actively targeted and compromised at least six healthcare organizations in Taiwan. Security researchers from Trellix report the Go-developed malware uses advanced evasion and propagation techniques, including Group Policy Object (GPO) abuse and Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver (BYOVD) attacks to disable security software. The attackers operate a dedicated data leak site, employing a double-extortion model that puts immense pressure on critical healthcare providers to pay ransoms and prevent the release of sensitive patient data.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Analysis of the CrazyHunter ransomware campaign targeting Taiwanese healthcare. Learn about its advanced TTPs, including GPO abuse and BYOVD attacks, and find mitigation strategies.

Article Slug: crazyhunter-ransomware-cripples-taiwanese-hospitals-with-advanced-tactics

Published Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Instagram Denies Breach After Password Bug Sparks Widespread Panic
item.description:
Headline: Instagram Denies Breach After Password Bug Sparks Widespread Panic

Summary:
Instagram's parent company, Meta, has denied that its systems were breached after a bug caused a wave of legitimate but unsolicited password reset emails to be sent to users, sparking fears of a mass compromise. The incident coincided with the circulation of a 17.5 million user dataset on a hacker forum, which further fueled breach speculation. However, Meta clarified the password emails were due to a now-fixed bug that did not expose accounts. Security researchers have assessed the leaked data as a repackaged version of an old dataset from 2017, not the result of a new breach. Despite the lack of a new intrusion, the events increase the risk of targeted phishing attacks against users.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Instagram denies a new data breach after a password reset bug and the reappearance of an old 17.5M user dataset caused panic. Learn about the real risks and how to stay safe.

Article Slug: instagram-denies-breach-amid-password-reset-bug-and-data-leak-confusion

Published Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: G7 Urges Financial Sector to Prepare for Quantum Computing Threat
item.description:
Headline: G7 Urges Financial Sector to Prepare for Quantum Computing Threat

Summary:
The G7 Cyber Expert Group (CEG), co-chaired by the U.S. Department of the Treasury and the Bank of England, has issued a public statement and roadmap advising the global financial sector to begin a coordinated transition to quantum-resilient technology. The guidance warns that advanced quantum computers will eventually be able to break the public-key cryptography that secures the world's financial transactions. The roadmap encourages financial institutions to start assessing their quantum risks and developing formal plans for migrating to post-quantum cryptography (PQC) standards, such as those being developed by NIST, to counter 'harvest now, decrypt later' attacks.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The G7 Cyber Expert Group has released a roadmap for the financial sector to transition to post-quantum cryptography (PQC) to defend against future threats from quantum computers.

Article Slug: g7-issues-roadmap-for-post-quantum-cryptography-in-financial-sector

Published Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Supply Chain Attack: Malicious npm Packages Steal Credentials from n8n Automation Platform
item.description:
Headline: Supply Chain Attack: Malicious npm Packages Steal Credentials from n8n Automation Platform

Summary:
A novel supply chain attack discovered by Endor Labs is targeting users of the n8n workflow automation platform. Attackers are publishing malicious packages to the npm registry, disguised as legitimate 'community nodes' for popular services. When an unsuspecting user installs one of these nodes and enters their credentials (e.g., OAuth tokens, API keys), the malicious code exfiltrates the entire credential store from the n8n instance to an attacker-controlled server. This gives the attackers access to all services connected to the victim's n8n workflows, such as Salesforce and Stripe, creating a significant risk of widespread data breaches and financial fraud.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new supply chain attack targets the n8n workflow automation platform via malicious npm packages, leading to total credential theft. Learn how the attack works and how to protect your n8n instance.

Article Slug: malicious-npm-packages-target-n8n-automation-platform-in-supply-chain-attack

Published Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Cyber-Fraud Now Top Global Threat, Surpassing Ransomware, WEF Report Finds
item.description:
Headline: Cyber-Fraud Now Top Global Threat, Surpassing Ransomware, WEF Report Finds

Summary:
The World Economic Forum's (WEF) 'Global Cybersecurity Outlook 2026' report, produced with Accenture, reveals a major shift in the threat landscape: cyber-enabled fraud and phishing have now surpassed ransomware as the top concern for global business leaders. The report highlights that fraud has reached 'record highs,' with 77% of leaders reporting an increase. It also identifies Artificial Intelligence as the most consequential force shaping cybersecurity in 2026, with 94% of leaders agreeing it will be the biggest factor. AI is seen as a double-edged sword, accelerating both offensive capabilities and defensive solutions, while growing concerns about data leaks from generative AI persist.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Threat Intelligence, Regulatory

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The World Economic Forum's 2026 cybersecurity report finds that cyber-fraud has overtaken ransomware as the top global threat, with AI set to be the biggest driver of change.

Article Slug: wef-report-cyber-fraud-overtakes-ransomware-as-top-threat

Published Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Pro-Russian Hacktivist Group NoName057(16) Unleashes Massive DDoS Campaign Against UK
item.description:
Headline: Pro-Russian Hacktivist Group NoName057(16) Unleashes Massive DDoS Campaign Against UK

Summary:
The pro-Russian hacktivist group NoName057(16) conducted a highly coordinated and intensive Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) campaign against United Kingdom infrastructure between January 5 and 11, 2026. A report from SOCRadar details 1,812 attack entries targeting 86 unique domains, with 85% of the attacks focused on the UK. The primary targets were government services (55%), but the campaign also hit critical infrastructure, including major seaports and rail networks. The attacks are coordinated through the group's 'DDoSia' project, which uses a volunteer-driven botnet managed via Telegram.

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Pro-Russian hacktivist group NoName057(16) targets the UK with a massive DDoS campaign, hitting government and critical infrastructure. Analysis of the attacks and mitigation strategies.

Article Slug: pro-russian-hacktivists-target-uk-with-massive-ddos-campaign

Published Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: GoBruteforcer Botnet Exploits Weak Credentials on Linux Servers to Target Crypto Wallets
item.description:
Headline: GoBruteforcer Botnet Exploits Weak Credentials on Linux Servers to Target Crypto Wallets

Summary:
A modular Go-based botnet named GoBruteforcer is actively compromising internet-facing Linux servers by brute-forcing weak credentials for services like FTP, MySQL, and PostgreSQL. According to Check Point Research, the campaign's success is fueled by the widespread use of default or weak passwords, often found in AI-generated server deployment examples. Once compromised, servers are added to an IRC-controlled botnet and used to scan for more victims. The attackers have a clear financial motive, as they have been observed deploying tools on compromised hosts to scan for and drain TRON and Binance Smart Chain cryptocurrency wallets.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Cyberattack, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A Go-based botnet called GoBruteforcer is targeting Linux servers, exploiting weak credentials to steal cryptocurrency from TRON and Binance Smart Chain wallets. Learn how it works and how to defend against it.

Article Slug: gobuteforcer-botnet-exploits-weak-credentials-on-linux-servers

Published Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Margaritaville at Sea Faces Class Action Lawsuit Over 2025 Data Breach
item.description:
Headline: Margaritaville at Sea Faces Class Action Lawsuit Over 2025 Data Breach

Summary:
A class action lawsuit has been filed against Classica Cruise Operator Ltd., the operator of Margaritaville at Sea, following a data breach in September 2025. The lawsuit alleges the cruise line was negligent in protecting customer data, which resulted in the compromise of extensive Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and Protected Health Information (PHI). The breach, reportedly carried out by the Lynx ransomware group, is said to have exposed names, passport details, Social Security numbers, and financial data. The plaintiff seeks damages for affected customers, who now face an increased risk of identity theft and fraud.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A class action lawsuit has been filed against Margaritaville at Sea's operator, alleging negligence in a 2025 data breach that exposed customer PII and PHI.

Article Slug: margaritaville-at-sea-sued-over-customer-data-breach

Published Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: International 'Black Axe' Cybercrime Gang Disrupted in Spain, 34 Arrested
item.description:
Headline: International 'Black Axe' Cybercrime Gang Disrupted in Spain, 34 Arrested

Summary:
A joint international law enforcement operation involving Spanish and German police, with support from Europol, has resulted in the arrest of 34 individuals in Spain suspected of belonging to the notorious 'Black Axe' criminal organization. The highly structured, Nigerian-origin network is accused of a wide range of cyber-enabled fraud, including business email compromise (BEC) and romance scams. This specific cell is believed to be responsible for over €5.9 million in fraud losses and was actively recruiting money mules in Spain to launder the proceeds of their global criminal activities.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Policy and Compliance, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A joint operation by Spanish police, German police, and Europol has dismantled a major cell of the 'Black Axe' cybercrime network in Spain, arresting 34 individuals.

Article Slug: black-axe-cyber-fraud-network-dismantled-in-spain

Published Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Everest Hacking Group Claims Major Breach of Nissan, Alleges 900GB Data Theft
item.description:
Headline: Everest Hacking Group Claims Major Breach of Nissan, Alleges 900GB Data Theft

Summary:
The Everest hacking group has claimed responsibility for a significant cyberattack against Japanese automaker Nissan, alleging the exfiltration of approximately 900 GB of sensitive corporate data. On January 10, 2026, the group posted its claims and sample data on its dark web leak site. The published samples, which include screenshots and directory listings, suggest the stolen data contains proprietary designs, financial information, employee records, and customer data. Everest is a Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) group known for its double-extortion tactics. Nissan has not yet publicly confirmed the breach.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The Everest ransomware group has claimed a major cyberattack on Nissan Motor Co., alleging the theft of 900 GB of sensitive data, including proprietary designs and customer information.

Article Slug: everest-ransomware-group-claims-major-breach-of-nissan

Published Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: High-Severity Code Injection Flaw in Open WebUI (CVE-2025-64496) Allows RCE
item.description:
Headline: High-Severity Code Injection Flaw in Open WebUI (CVE-2025-64496) Allows RCE

Summary:
A high-severity vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-64496, has been discovered in Open WebUI, a popular self-hosted interface for large language models (LLMs). The flaw, found by Cato Networks, allows a malicious AI server to inject arbitrary JavaScript code into a user's browser session. This can be exploited to steal authentication tokens and take over the user's account. If the compromised user has specific permissions enabled, the vulnerability can be escalated to achieve full remote code execution (RCE) on the host server. The issue affects Open WebUI versions 0.6.34 and older and was patched in version 0.6.35.

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: TechArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A critical code injection vulnerability (CVE-2025-64496) in Open WebUI can lead to account takeover and remote code execution. Learn how the flaw works and how to patch it.

Article Slug: high-severity-code-injection-flaw-in-open-webui-disclosed

item.title: NEW: Manage My Health Breach: 126,000 New Zealand Patients' Data Exposed
item.description:
Headline: Manage My Health Breach: 126,000 New Zealand Patients' Data Exposed

Summary:
Manage My Health, New Zealand's largest online patient portal, has confirmed it suffered a major cyberattack in late December 2025. The breach may have exposed the health documents of between 108,000 and 126,000 patients. An attacker using the alias 'Kazu' has claimed responsibility on a cybercrime forum, demanding a US$60,000 ransom and threatening to leak over 400,000 stolen health documents. The company states the breach was limited to its 'Health Documents' module and that its core patient database and user credentials were not accessed. The incident has prompted a government review in New Zealand.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: New Zealand's largest patient portal, Manage My Health, has suffered a major data breach, potentially exposing the health documents of up to 126,000 people. An attacker is demanding a ransom.

Article Slug: new-zealand-manage-my-health-patient-portal-suffers-major-data-breach

Published Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT
